required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In-vivo Efficacy Study of Patient Pre-operative Preps
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Antimicrobial Efficacy of 3M CHG/IPA Preoperative Skin Preparation Against Resident Human Skin Flora on the Abdominal and Inguinal Regions

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the antimicrobial efficacy of the 3M CHG/IPA Prep on skin flora of the abdominal and inguinal regions of human subjects.

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary efficacy is evaluated by demonstration that the product provides a lower bound of the 95% confidence interval of percent responders that is greater than or equal to 70%.
On the abdominal sites, a responder is defined as a subject with a 2-log10 per cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora does not return to baseline at 6 hours.
On the inguinal sites, a responder is defined as a subject with a 3-log10 per cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora does not return to baseline at 6 hours.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes post-product application and 6 hour post-product application
primary_outcome.description: On the abdominal region a responder was a subject with a 2 log10/cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora did not return to baseline. On the inguinal region a responder was a subject with a 3 log10/cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora did not return to baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of Skin Flora 6 Hours Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: log10/cm2 reduction of skin flora, relative to treatment day baseline (log10/cm2), at 6 hours post-treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Reduction of Skin Flora 10 Minutes Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: log10/cm2 reduction of skin flora, relative to treatment day baseline (log10/cm2), at 10 minutes post-treatment
Log10/cm2 recovery of skin flora at 6 hours following application of study treatment
Log10/cm2 recovery of skin flora at 10 minutes following application of study treatments

secondary_outcome.measure: Skin Flora Baseline for the Abdominal and Inguinal Region.
secondary_outcome.description: Log10/cm2 baseline skin flora for abdominal and inguinal regions

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety as Assessed by Skin Irritation (Dryness, Edema, Erythema, Rash) Rating Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (pre-treatment) and 10 minute post-treatment and 6 hour post-treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Skin irritation (dryness, edema, erythema, rash) assessed on the test sites using a 0-3 rating scale: 0=no reaction, 1=mild, 2=moderated, 3=severe

clinical_study.condition: Bacterial Reduction on Skin Flora Post-product Application

arm_group.description: Apply topically for 30 seconds to the abdominal region or 2 minutes to the inguinal region, and allow to dry for 3 minutes.
Apply topically for 30 seconds to the abdominal region or 2 minutes to the inguinal region, and allow to dry for 3 minutes.
Apply topically for 30 seconds to the abdominal region or 2 minutes to the inguinal region, and allow to dry for 3 minutes.
Apply topically for 30 seconds to the abdominal region or 2 minutes to the inguinal region, and allow to dry for 3 minutes.

intervention.other_name: Chlorhexidine gluconate 2% w/v / Isopropyl alcohol 70% v/v
Chlorhexidine gluconate 2% w/v / Isopropyl alcohol 70% v/v
Chlorhexidine gluconate 2% w/v / Isopropyl alcohol 70% v/v

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects of any race
- Subjects in good general health
- Minimum skin flora baseline requirements on abdomen and groin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any tattoos, scars, breaks in the skin, or any form of dermatitis, or other skin disorders (including acne) on the applicable test areas
- Topical antimicrobial exposure within 14 days prior to screening and treatment days
- Use of systemic or topical antibiotics, steroid medications, or any other products known to affect the normal microbial flora of the skin within 14 days prior to screening and treatment days

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This is a randomized, paired comparison design where each subject received 2 of the planned treatments, 1 on the left side & 1 on the right. Each subject provided 2 abdomen test sites, left & right and/or 2 inguen test sites, left & right. 406 subjects were randomized for the abdomen region & 391 subjects randomized for the inguen region resulting in 426 subjects providing 1594 applications of test products on 2 anatomical regions.

group.description: Applied topically to the abdominal region for 30 seconds.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not meet treatment day baseline

baseline.population: Subjects with average treatment day baseline counts of greater than or equal to 3.00 log10 CFU/cm2 bilaterally on the abdominal region and/or greater than or equal to 5.00 log10 CFU/cm2 bilaterally on the inguinal region were included in the analysis.

class.title: Native Hawiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Responder Rate
outcome.description: On the abdominal region a responder was a subject with a 2 log10/cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora did not return to baseline. On the inguinal region a responder was a subject with a 3 log10/cm2 bacterial reduction at 10 minutes and for whom the skin flora did not return to baseline.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, 10 minutes post-product application and 6 hour post-product application
outcome.population: The primary analysis data set used a Modified Intent to Treat population. Subjects were excluded who did not meet the treatment day baseline requirements of either > or equal to 3.0 log10 on the abdomen test site or 5.0 log10 on the inguinal test site.

outcome.time_frame: Assessed at baseline (pre-treatment) and 10 minute post-treatment and 6 hour post-treatment.
outcome.population: The primary safety analysis data set used an Intent to Treat population.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected on treatment day. By definition, all AEs were treatment-emergent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
